events.department: NADIMPALLI SATYANARAYANA RAJU INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (NSRIT) AUTONOMOUS
events.description: A comprehensive technical and management fest, 'TECHNIMBLE 2025', organized by NSRIT. The event features a variety of activities including Poster Presentations, Paper Presentations, Project Expos, Technical Quizzes, Modeling & 3D Printing, Technical Treasure Hunts, Bridge Bust, B-Quiz, Ad-Mad, and Startup Idea competitions across multiple disciplines.
events.target_audience: Students from various engineering and management disciplines (CSE, CSD, CSM, ECE, EEE, MECH, CIVIL, MBA, MCA)
events.additional_info: Conveners: Dr.A.S.S.V. Ram Kumar, Dr.V. Sreerama Murthy. Coordinator: Sri. N. Viswanadha Reddy. The institute is accredited by NBA (National Board of Accreditation). Registration can be done by scanning the provided QR code.

events.department: NSRIT Autonomous, Department of CSE, CSM & CSD
events.description: This 2-day workshop is designed to protect systems, networks, and data from cyber threats. Participants will gain hands-on experience with Kali Linux, Nmap, and real-world hacking tools. They will learn to secure Wi-Fi networks and systems from common cyberattacks, and understand advanced techniques like MITM attacks, dark web usage, and bug bounty hunting. The workshop also includes building practical problem-solving skills through a Capture the Flag challenge.
events.prizes: Awards for top performers in the Capture the Flag challenge.
events.additional_info: This is a 2-day workshop organized by NSRIT Autonomous, Department of CSE, CSM & CSD, possibly in association with ACM and Computer Society of India (CSI) given the logos.
events.raw_text: NSRIT AUTONOMOUS 2-DAY WORKSHOP ON CYBER SECURITY 10th & 11th Oct, 2025 Designed to protect systems, networks and data from cyber threats. Registration fee:150/- Gain hands-on experience with kali Linux, Nmap, and real-world hacking tools. Learn to secure Wi-Fi networks and systems from common cyberattacks Understand advanced techniques like MITM attacks, dark Web usage, and Bug Bounty hunting Build Practical problem-solving skill through a Capture the flag challenge with awards for top performers Department of CSE, CSM & CSD ACM CSI Scanned with OKEN Scanner

events.event_name: Build Your Own IoT Smart Devices
events.department: Nadimpalli Satyanarayana Raju Institute of Technology (NSRIT)
events.venue: Nadimpalli Satyanarayana Raju Institute of Technology, Sontyam, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh - 531173
events.description: This Student Development Programme aims to provide hands-on experience and knowledge to design Smart IoT Devices. Participants will learn practical methods for Microprocessor and Microcontroller, Computer organization and Architecture, Embedded C & Assembly Language. The program offers exposure to real-world IoT products, applications of IoT and embedded systems, and product design. It also includes guidance on writing and publishing research papers. Selected students will be offered a paid internship in NSRIT Start-UPS immediately.
events.prizes: Paid Internship in NSRIT Start-UPS for selected students.
topics: Introduction to IoT and Its Architecture
IoT Product Design and Mini Project
events.target_audience: 2nd year students of CSE, EEE and ME. The SDP is also open to all interested students who want to understand the concepts of theory and practical applications of IoT to solve real-world problems through their designs and deployment.
events.additional_info: Organized by Nadimpalli Satyanarayana Raju Institute of Technology (NSRIT Autonomous). College Code: NSRT. Visit website: www.nsrit.edu.in.
events.raw_text:
STUDENT DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME ON BUILD YOUR OWN IOT SMART DEVICES
02-06 JANUARY 2026
WHY YOU SHOULD ATTEND ?
Design your Smart IoT Devices and Participate in various Design Contests
Learn hands-on practical methods for Microprocessor and Microcontroller, Computer organization and Architecture, Embedded C & Assembly Language.
Get practical exposure to IOT and design 20 real-world Products.
Understand real-world applications of IoT and embedded systems and its Product Designs.
Write a your own Research Paper and Publish
Selected Students will Gets The Paid Internship in NSRIT Start-UPS immediately
PROGRAMME AIMS
Introduction to IoT and Its Architecture
Introduction to Embedded C & Assembly
Microprocessor and Microcontroller
IoT and its Applications Development
IoT Product Design and Mini Project
WHO SHOULD ATTEND
students of 2nd year of CSE, EEE and ME. The SDP is open to all interested students who wants to understand the concepts of theory and its practical's together and use the same skills to solve the real world problems through their designs and deploy.
RESOURCE PERSONS
Prof. S R N Reddy- HOD-CSE, IGDTUW, Delhi
Mr. Pratap Reddy- Product Designer, Delhi
Dr. PNE. Naveen-Lead-IIE, NSRIT
Dr. Rajendra Prasad- Faculty-EEE, NSRIT
Mrs. Phani Madhuri- Faculty-ECE, NSRIT
REGISTRATION FEE 500 ₹
Nadimpalli Satyanarayana Raju Institute of Technology Sontyam, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh - 531173
NSRIT AUTONOMOUS COLLEGE CODE NSRT
Visit Our Website www.nsrit.edu.in

events.department: N.S.R.I.T.
events.description: A month-long awareness campaign focused on promoting national road safety. The initiative, also known as 'Road Safety Campaign 2026' (सड़क सुरक्षा अभियान 2026), aims to encourage safe practices and reduce road accidents.
events.target_audience: General Public, Road Users, Drivers, Pedestrians
events.additional_info: The event is affiliated with www.nsrit.edu.in, which likely serves as an organizing or supporting institution. The slogan is 'भारत करे, सुरक्षित रहे' (India makes it safe, stays safe).
events.raw_text: NATIONAL ROAD SAFETY MONTH, 2026 1-31 January सड़क सुरक्षा अभियान 2026 भारत करे, सुरक्षित रहे www.nsrit.edu.in ROAD SAFETY PLEASE SLOW DOWN THINK ROAD SAFETY LEFT

events.description: An innovation challenge and 24-hour hackathon, part of the Vizag Tri-Mobility Challenge 2K26, featuring contests in Electric Vehicles (EV), Drones, Hardware Innovation, Software Innovation, and general Student Innovation. Participants will compete for prizes worth ₹1,80,000.

contact_persons.name: Dr. R. S. R. KRISHNAM NAIDU

events.target_audience: Students, particularly those interested in Electrical and Electronics Engineering and interdisciplinary innovation.

The Department of Electrical & Electronics Engineering is accredited by NBA under Tier I. For more details, visit www.nsrit.edu.in. Follow @nsrit_eee_club on Instagram. A QR code is provided for registration.

events.event_name: STUDENT DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME ON BUILD YOUR OWN IOT SMART DEVICES
events.department: Nadimapalli Satyanarayana Raju Institute of Technology (NSRIT)
events.venue: Nadimapalli Satyanarayana Raju Institute of Technology, Sontyam, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh - 531173
events.description: This Student Development Programme (SDP) aims to provide hands-on practical methods for designing Smart IoT Devices. Participants will learn about Microprocessor and Microcontroller, Computer Organization and Architecture, Embedded C & Assembly Language. The program offers practical exposure to IoT, focusing on designing real-world products and understanding applications of IoT and embedded systems. It also includes guidance on product design and mini-projects. Attendees will have the opportunity to write their own research papers and publish them. Selected students may also receive a paid internship at NSRIT Start-UPS immediately.
events.prizes: Paid Internship in NSRIT Start-UPS for selected students
topics: Introduction to IoT and Its Architecture
IoT Product Design and Mini Project
Real-world applications of IoT and embedded systems
events.target_audience: 2nd year students of CSE, EEE, and ME. The SDP is open to all interested students who want to understand the concepts of theory and its practicals, and use these skills to solve real-world problems through design and deployment.
events.additional_info: Website: www.nsrit.edu.in. College Code: NSRT. Resource Persons: Prof. S R N Reddy (HOD-CSE, IGDTUW, Delhi), Mr. Pratap Reddy (Product Designer, Delhi), Dr. PNE. Naveen (Lead-IIE, NSRIT), Dr. Rajendra Prasad (Faculty-EEE, NSRIT), Mrs. Phani Madhuri (Faculty-ECE, NSRIT).
events.raw_text: STUDENT DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME ON BUILD YOUR OWN IOT SMART DEVICES 02-06 JANUARY 2026 WHY YOU SHOULD ATTEND ? Design your Smart IoT Devices and Participate in various Design Contests Learn hands-on practical methods for Microprocessor and Microcontroller, Computer organization and Architecture, Embedded C & Assembly Language. Get practical exposure to IoT and design 20 real-world Products. Understand real-world applications of IoT and embedded systems and its Product Designs. Write a your own Research Paper and Publish Selected Students will Gets The Paid Internship in NSRIT Start-UPS immediately PROGRAMME AIMS Introduction to IoT and Its Architecture Introduction to Embedded C & Assembly Microprocessor and Microcontroller IoT and its Applications Development IoT Product Design and Mini Project WHO SHOULD ATTEND students of 2nd year of CSE, EEE and ME. The SDP is open to all interested students who wants to understand the concepts of theory and its practical's together and use the same skills to solve the real world problems through their designs and deploy. events.department: NSRIT
events.description: A month-long campaign dedicated to promoting road safety awareness. The event is also referred to as 'सड़क सुरक्षा अभियान 2026' (Road Safety Campaign 2026) with the slogan 'भारत करे, सुरक्षित चले' (India walks, walks safely).
events.target_audience: General Public, Drivers, Pedestrians (implied)
events.additional_info: For more information, visit www.nsrit.edu.in
events.raw_text: NATIONAL ROAD SAFETY MONTH, 2026 1-31 January सड़क सुरक्षा अभियान 2026 भारत करे, सुरक्षित चले www.nsrit.edu.in ROAD SAFETY PLEASE SLOW DOWN THINK ROAD SAFETY LEFT STOP

events.department: Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Nadimpalli Satyanarayana Raju Institute of Technology (NSRIT)
events.description: A multi-domain challenge and a 24-hour hackathon focusing on innovation in mobility, specifically covering contests in Electric Vehicles, Drones, Hardware Innovation, Software Innovation, and general Student Innovation.

contact_persons.name: Dr. R. S. R. KRISHNAM NAIDU

events.target_audience: Students, particularly those interested in Electrical and Electronics Engineering, innovation, electric vehicles, and drones.
events.additional_info: Organized by Nadimpalli Satyanarayana Raju Institute of Technology (NSRIT) in association with IEEE, Morris Garages, and Institution's Innovation Council (Ministry of I&B Initiative). NSRIT's Department of Electrical & Electronics Engineering is accredited by NBA under Tier I. Scan QR code for registration. Instagram handle: @nsrit_eee_club. Website: www.nsrit.edu.in.

events.department: Lendi Institute of Engineering & Technology
events.venue: Vizag-Vizianagaram Road-NH-43, Denkada, Jonnada, Andhra Pradesh 535005
events.description: A national innovation and technology summit with the theme 'Innovation for Rural Empowerment & Sustainable Technology'. The event spans three days, featuring a 48-hour hackathon (National Hacktriad 2.0), various innovation events, cultural events, and emerging-tech talks by industry experts. It aims to provide problem statements from top industry experts and offers internship opportunities for winners.
events.registration_fee:
Varies by event:
- National Hacktriad 2.0: ₹750/- per head (includes food and accommodation)
- Other sub-events (Mech EL-Ctronics, Startup Ideathon, Rural Innovation Challenge): ₹499/- per head (students can participate in any two events)
- Spot Events (Debugging Contest): ₹100/- per head
- Cultural Events: Free
events.prizes: Total Cash Prize: ₹4 Lakhs. For HACKTRIAD 2.0: 1st Prize: ₹1,00,000/-, 2nd Prize: ₹50,000/-, 3rd Prize: ₹25,000/-. Internship opportunities in industry for winners.
topics: Innovation for Rural Empowerment & Sustainable Technology (Overall Theme)
Startup Ideathon (Poster Presentation, Startup Pitch Event)
Rural Innovation Challenge (App for Rural Empowerment)
Hacktriad 2.0 - Day 2: Idea Pitching & Prototype Development
events.target_audience: Students, innovators, and possibly industry professionals interested in technology, innovation, rural empowerment, and sustainable development.
events.additional_info: Organized by Lendi Institute of Engineering & Technology, an Autonomous Institution, accredited by NAAC A+ and NBA. Supported by Institution's Innovation Council, Ministry of Education's Innovation Cell, and IEEE Vizianagaram Sub Section. The institution celebrates 18 years of excellence. Problem statements will be provided by top industry experts. Website for more details & registrations: https://lendinit.lendi.edu.in/
events.raw_text: Lendi An Autonomous Institution Institute of Engineering & Technology NAAC A+ NBA National Board of Accreditation Institution's Innovation Council Ministry of Education's Innovation Cell Government of India IEEE Vizianagaram Sub Section 18 Years of Excellence LNIT SUMMIT - 2K26 Lendi National Innovation & Technology Summit - 2K26 Feb 26th, 27th & 28th 2026 Theme: Innovation for Rural Empowerment & Sustainable Technology NATIONAL HACKTRIAD 2.0 48 Hours Hackathon ₹750/- Per Head Food and accommodation free Mech EL-Ctronics Innovation Expo Startup Ideathon Poster Presentation Startup Pitch Event Rural Innovation Challenge App for Rural Empowerment Spot Events Debugging Contest ₹100/- per Head Cultural Events Free Emerging-Tech Talks By Industry experts ₹499/- Per Head. Students can participate in any two events Prizes Feb 26th 2026 Bootcamp Inauguration Feb 27th 2026 Idea Pitching & Prototype Development Feb 28th 2026 Prototype Development 1st Prize : ₹1,00,000/- 2nd Prize : ₹ 50,000/- 3rd Prize : ₹ 25,000/- FOR HACKTRIAD 2.0 4 Lakhs Cash Prize Total Problem Statements from Top Industry Experts Internship opportunities in industry for winners CHIEF PATRONS SRI. events.department: LNIT SUMMIT (Lendi Engineering College)
events.description: Collaborate, code, and create change. Because the future is built on campus. The event flow includes: Day 1: Inauguration, Keynote, Bootcamp; Day 2: Hackathon Development (Full Day); Day 3: Evaluation, Demo, Valedictory.
events.target_audience: Students, Developers, Teams (3-5 persons)
events.additional_info: Team Size: 3-5 persons per team. For more details, visit: https://lendinit.lendi.edu.in. Organized by LNIT SUMMIT and supported by LENDI, AICTE, NBA, Institutions Innovation Council, NAAC, IEEE.
events.raw_text: LENDI AICTE NBA NATIONAL BOARD OF ACCREDITATION INSTITUTIONS INNOVATION COUNCIL NAAC IEEE 18 EXCELLENCE LNIT SUMMIT PRESENTS HACKTRAID 2.0 2026 26th FEB - 28th FEB 2026 Collaborate, code, and create change.Because the future is built on campus. EVENT FLOW: Day 1: Inauguration • Keynote • Bootcamp Day 2: Hackathon Development (Full Day) Day 3: Evaluation • Demo • Valedictory REGISTRATION FEE: ₹750 / HEAD 3-5 PERSONS / TEAM PRICE POOL 1,75,000/- FOR MORE DETAILS https://lendinit.lendi.edu.in lendi engg college LENDI LIET lendi_2008@yahoo.com 7093461111 @lendi6086
